info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 12 at 7:42AM CDT until July 12 at 1:15PM CDT by NWS Springfield MO
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of south central Missouri, including the following counties, Dent and Shannon.
* WHEN...Until 115 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. Some low-water crossings may become impassable.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 742 AM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following low water crossings... Mahans Creek at County Road 501 and Sinking Creek at County Road 568. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Eminence, Bunker, Round Spring, West Eminence, Midridge, Alley Spring, Echo Bluff State Park, Ozark National Scenic Riverways and Current River State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON
